Component: Layout - Page Heros

Hero Image Component

Hero Images are the first thing the user sees when they load up one of our pages. There's not much to it. You'll notice these are created using the <picture> element and we there are two <source>s. You can have as many of these as you want. The two that are here match to our media queries for mobile (media="(max-width: 640px)") and desktop (media="(min-width: 640px)").

Additionally, for each of the breakpoints, if you provide retina (2x) and non-retina, the browser will choose the appropriate image based on the pixel density of the device being used.

The most basic version of this is simply adding the hero. This is currently in use (as a video element instead of a picture element) on the Model 3 page.

▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
</section>

Available Options

  • Hero with Title and Subnav
  • Hero with Title Only
  • Hero with Sub-nav Only
  • Other Options
  • Integrating with the Side Scrolling Menu

There are several other options available to you with this hero component. Some of them much more common than others, but for the sake of completeness, all are documented.

Hero with Title and Subnav

The most common usage will be a hero image with a title and subnav. This type of setup is currently in use on all of our top-level marketing pages (Energy, Solar Roof, Model S, Model X, etc).

Your code should have the following:

  1. The default setup
  2. The tsla-hero-content wrapper element (usually a div). This should be placed directly after the <picture> element
    • A tsla-hero-title element (usually an h1). This should be placed inside the tsla-hero-content wrapper element.
    • A tsla-hero-nav_container element (usually a nav). This should be placed inside the tsla-hero-content wrapper element.

Hero Title

  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
  <div class="tsla-hero-content container">
    <h1 class="tsla-hero-title">Hero Title</h1>
    <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container">
      <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 1" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-nav--item_selected">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 2" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 3" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
        </li>
      </ol>
    </nav>
  </div>
</section>

Hero with Title Only

You may want to insert a hero image, but only want a title to be overlaid on top of the hero. This pattern can work well if you're on a standalone page with little-to-no related pages.

Your code should have the following:

  1. The default setup
  2. The tsla-hero-content wrapper element (usually a div). This should be placed directly after the <picture> element
    • A tsla-hero-title element (usually an h1). This should be placed inside the tsla-hero-content wrapper element.

Hero Title

▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
  <div class="tsla-hero-content container">
    <h1 class="tsla-hero-title">Hero Title</h1>
  </div>
</section>

Hero with Sub-nav Only

The least common option among all of these is a Hero with a sub nav only.

Your code should have the following:

  1. The default setup
  2. The tsla-hero-content wrapper element (usually a div). This should be placed directly after the <picture> element
    • A tsla-hero-nav_container element (usually a nav). This should be placed inside the tsla-hero-content wrapper element.
  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
  <div class="tsla-hero-content container">
    <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container">
      <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 1" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-nav--item_selected">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 2" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 3" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
        </li>
      </ol>
    </nav>
  </div>
</section>

Other Options

By default, the text color will be dark, but maybe you are putting this on top of a hero image that is dark as well. The solve for this would be to add a class to the wrapper to use the alternate color scheme.

Hero Title

  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero tsla-hero-alternate">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
  <div class="tsla-hero-content container">
    <h1 class="tsla-hero-title">Hero Title</h1>
    <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container">
      <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 1" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-nav--item_selected">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 2" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 3" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
        </li>
      </ol>
    </nav>
  </div>
</section>

Integrating with the Side Scrolling Menu

Maybe you want to integrate with the side scrolling menu when viewed on mobile?

There are 3 changes you would need to make to the DOM to accomodate for this change:

  1. Add the class tsla-sidescroll-menu to <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container">
  2. Add the data attribute data-tsla_showsidescroll_arrow="true"> to <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container">
  3. Add the arrow icon (if desired on mobile): <i class="tsla-sidescroll-arrow tsla-icon-angle_right"></i>. This goes directly after the closing </ol> of <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">

Everything else should "just work".

Hero Title

  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
  4. Link 4
  5. Link 5
  6. Link 6
  7. Link 7
  8. Link 8
  9. Link 9

  11. Link 11
▲ 
<section class="tsla-hero tsla-hero-alternate">
  <picture class="tsla-hero-image">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/320/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/640/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" media="(max-width: 640px)">
    <source srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" media="(min-width: 640px)">
    <img class="tsla-hero-fallback" src="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO" srcset="//placehold.it/1440x500/333333/dddddd&text=FPO, //placehold.it/2880x1000/333333/dddddd&text=FPO 2x" alt="Hero Component">
  </picture>
  <div class="tsla-hero-content container">
    <h1 class="tsla-hero-title">Hero Title</h1>
    <nav class="tsla-hero-nav_container tsla-sidescroll-menu" data-tsla_showsidescroll_arrow="true">
      <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 1" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-nav--item_selected">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 2" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 3" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 4" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 4</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 5" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 5</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 6" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 6</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 7" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 7</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 8" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 8</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 9" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 9</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 10" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 10</a>
        </li>
        <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
          <a href="#" title="Nav link 11" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 11</a>
        </li>
      </ol>
      <i class="tsla-sidescroll-arrow tsla-icon-angle_right"></i>
    </nav>
  </div>
</section>
